title: WorldNPCSpawn
description: A spawning configuration used to spawn NPCs around the world.

NPCs.description: A required list of Role Spawn Parameters defining each NPC that can be spawned and their relative weights.
NPCs.markdownDescription: A required list of **Role Spawn Parameters** defining each NPC that can be spawned and their relative weights.

Despawn.description: Optional Despawn Parameters to control NPC despawning.
Despawn.markdownDescription: Optional **Despawn Parameters** to control NPC despawning.

DayTimeRange.description: An optional hour range within which the NPCs/beacon will spawn (between 0 and 24).

MoonPhaseRange.description: An optional moon phase range during which the NPCs/beacon will spawn (must be greater than or equal to 0).

LightRanges.title: Map of LightType
LightRanges.description: Optional light ranges to spawn the NPCs/beacon in, defined between 0 and 100.

SkyLight.description: Light level based on how deep under cover the position is relative to the open sky (e.g. inside a cave will be low SkyLight).

Sunlight.description: Light level based on time of day (peaks at around noon and is 0 during most of the night).

ScaleDayTimeRange.description:
If set to true, instead of using absolute hour values for DayTimeRange, it will be scaled based on the world's DaytimePortion.

 * 0 and 24 will represent the middle of the night portion.
 * 6 will represent the moment of sunrise.
 * 12 will represent the middle of the day portion.
 * 18 will represent the moment of sunset.

Environments.description: A required list of environments that this configuration covers. Each combination of environment and NPC in this configuration should be unique.

MoonPhaseWeightModifiers.description:
An array of modifiers which will be multiplied into the weights for each NPC in this config dependent on the current moon phase.

At present, Hytale has 5 moon phases, with day 0 being a full moon which gradually wanes up to day 4 which is a new moon. These are represented in the array indices.

Each modifier can only be between 0 and 2, where 0 means the NPC will not spawn at all, 1 will use the standard weight, and 2 will result in twice the spawns

e.g. `[ 0, 0, 0.5, 1, 2 ]` would result in NPCs that do not spawn during day 0 and day 1 (full moon and three quarters), would spawn half as much on day 2, the defined amount on day 3, and twice as many on day 4 (new moon).
